analyzed: pa med pa la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: bcom ldan rnyog pa med pa la //
analyzed: bcom ldan rnyog pa med pa la //
translated: To the stainless Bhagavān,

original: btung de rnyog med dka' 'grel 'di //
analyzed: btung de rnyog med dka' 'grel 'di //
translated: this stainless commentary on the difficult points,

original: gzhon nu zla bas dri med pa //
analyzed: gzhon nu zla bas dri med pa //
translated: the stainless one by the young moon,

original: 'dir ni ji bzhin brtsam par bya //
analyzed: 'dir ni ji bzhin brtsam par bya //
translated: here is composed just as it is.

original: rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the Stainless and so forth,

original: rnyog pa ni yid la byed pa'i rnyog pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa ni yid la byed pa'i rnyog pa'o //
translated: turbidity is the turbidity of mental activity.

original: de yang ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i phung po ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the aggregates with ignorance,

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning the latent tendencies of ignorance.

original: rnyog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ste /
translated: It is stainless,

original: yid la byed pa'i rnyog pa spangs pas ma rig pa'i bag chags med pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnyog pa spangs pas ma rig pa'i bag chags med pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: meaning free from the turbidity of mental activity, meaning free from the latent tendencies of ignorance.

original: 'di bag chags dang bcas pa'i sdig pa ma lus pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: 'di bag chags dang bcas pa'i sdig pa ma lus pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: This means free from all sins along with their latent tendencies.

original: /'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rab tu spangs pa'i ched du 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: /'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rab tu spangs pa'i ched du 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, one should strive to completely eliminate the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their propensities.🔽This is the meaning.

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa ni nyes pa thams cad kyi gleng gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa ni nyes pa thams cad kyi gleng gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the propensity for nescience is the basis for all faults.

original: gang la ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa med na de la ji ltar nyes pa'i bag chags gzhan dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang la ma rig pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa med na de la ji ltar nyes pa'i bag chags gzhan dag 'byung ste /
translated: If there is no propensity for nescience, how can the other propensities for faults arise?

original: de med na nyes pa gang zhig yod pa yin //
analyzed: de med na nyes pa gang zhig yod pa yin //
translated: If that does not exist, what fault is there?

original: de'i phyir rnyog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnyog pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is stainless,

original: sgrib pa gnyis bag chags pa thams cad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis bag chags pa thams cad med pa nyid do //
translated: because it is free from all propensities for the two obstructions.

original: rnyog pa de yang dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa de yang dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: That stainlessness is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: brjod par bya ba bstan la /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba bstan la /
translated: Having taught the topic,

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: he teaches the perfection of his own aim.🔽The aim is the attainment of the state of Vajradhara,

original: phan 'dod pas zhes bya ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid thob pa ni dgos pa ste /
analyzed: phan 'dod pas zhes bya ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid thob pa ni dgos pa ste /
translated: through the desire to benefit.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba'i rdo rje 'dzin mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gro ba'i rdo rje 'dzin mdzad pa'o //
translated: Because the Lord is the holder of the vajra of the world.

original: de dag gis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: These are called the perfections of the aims of others.

original: rnyog pa med pa de yang rnyog pa med pa'i khyab par snang ba med pa la sogs pa bye brag brgyad kyis ston te /
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa de yang rnyog pa med pa'i khyab par snang ba med pa la sogs pa bye brag brgyad kyis ston te /
translated: And that non-turbidity is shown by the eight particularities of non-appearance, etc.

original: de la rnyog pa ni khams gsum gyi spros pa la dmigs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de la rnyog pa ni khams gsum gyi spros pa la dmigs pa thams cad de /
translated: Therein, turbidity is all the objectifications of the elaborations of the three realms.

original: de 'di la yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since that does not exist here,

original: snang ba med pa 'di ni spros pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: snang ba med pa 'di ni spros pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: this non-appearance is what is meant by non-elaboration.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for non-apprehension.

original: snang ba med pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba med pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not non-appearance.

original: shes rab nyid snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don tam /
analyzed: shes rab nyid snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don tam /
translated: It is not that wisdom itself is not of the nature of appearance, or

original: 'di la snang ba med pa snang ba ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de la yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di la snang ba med pa snang ba ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: it is not that there is no appearance here, which is what is meant by non-appearance.🔽It does not exist there.

original: de rang nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: de rang nyid kyang med la /
translated: And that itself does not exist.

original: de'i rgyur yong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur yong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the cause of that.

original: rnam pa gsum @272b du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum @272b du bshad pa'o //
translated: It is explained in three ways.

original: dpe med pa ni de dang mnyam pa'i gnyis pa gzhal bya med pa'i phyir dper nye bar gzhag pa med pas mnyam zhing mtshungs pa med pa ste /🔽dpe med pa zhes bya ba'i don dang / de las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe med pa ni de dang mnyam pa'i gnyis pa gzhal bya med pa'i phyir dper nye bar gzhag pa med pas mnyam zhing mtshungs pa med pa ste / dpe med pa zhes bya ba'i don dang / de las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is incomparable because there is no second object of knowledge equal to it, and it is incomparable because there is no example to which it can be likened.

original: dpe med pa zhes bya ba'i don gyis de dang mnyam pa gnyis med pa'o //🔽de'i bdag nyid kyis 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: dpe med pa zhes bya ba'i don gyis de dang mnyam pa gnyis med pa'o // de'i bdag nyid kyis 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is incomparable because there is no second object of knowledge equal to it, and it is incomparable because there is no example to which it can be likened.

original: 'gro ba de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the nature of the world because it is the nature of that world.

original: ci ste dpe dang ldan /
analyzed: ci ste dpe dang ldan /
translated: If it were comparable,

original: brjod du med pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is inexpressible because it is not an object of expression.

original: tshig gi spyod yul ma yin zhing rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i yul las 'das pas /
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul ma yin zhing rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i yul las 'das pas /
translated: It is beyond the domain of words and thought.

original: rang yang dag pa'i rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang yang dag pa'i rig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of the body of mere correct knowledge.

original: brjod du med pa ma yin zhing brjod pa ma lus pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa ma yin zhing brjod pa ma lus pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is not inexpressible, but rather it is the absence of all expression.

original: brjod par mi nus pa dang / bstan du med pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par mi nus pa dang / bstan du med pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not expressible, and it is not demonstrable.

original: yul gyi bdag nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: yul gyi bdag nyid ma yin la /
translated: It is not an object,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yang blo'i yul ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yang blo'i yul ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: and it is not the object of the Buddha’s cognition.

original: rig pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cannot be known.

original: yul gyi bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pa'ang 'di ni yul can rang bzhin med pas 'dzin pa'i don to //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag nyid yod pa ma yin pa'ang 'di ni yul can rang bzhin med pas 'dzin pa'i don to //
translated: And although it is not an object, it is the object of the absence of intrinsic reality of the subject.

original: 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an error.

original: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa can ni /
analyzed: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa can ni /
translated: The absence of the apprehended is the absence of the apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa 'khrul pa can te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'khrul pa can te /
translated: The apprehender is an error.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: The intrinsic nature of the self-awareness of direct perception

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
translated: is explained as the characteristic of the non-error of the Blessed Lady.

original: bzod pa nyid nas bzung ste ngo bo nyid kyis dri ma med pa ltos pa med pas ngo bo nyid kyi skyon thams cad sgrib g-yogs spangs pas nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: bzod pa nyid nas bzung ste ngo bo nyid kyis dri ma med pa ltos pa med pas ngo bo nyid kyi skyon thams cad sgrib g-yogs spangs pas nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: From the very beginning, it is pure by nature, and since it is independent, it is tranquil, having abandoned all natural faults and obscurations.

original: gzod ma nyid nas ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzod ma nyid nas ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “pure by nature from the very beginning.”

original: 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i lus bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i lus bstan to //
translated: This shows the body of the innate Vajradhara.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma med pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma med pa yang gnyis te /
translated: The absence of adventitious stains is also twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma med pa'o //
translated: the absence of the stain of afflictions and the absence of the stain of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas bdag med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas bdag med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: With regard to that, the absence of the obscurations of afflictions is called “selflessness,”

original: spangs ba phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: spangs ba phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
translated: and this expresses the perfection of abandonment.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The absence of the obscurations to omniscience is called “purity,”

original: thob pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and this expresses the perfection of attainment.

original: 'di dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pa dang / thob pa'i bye brag gis gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pa dang / thob pa'i bye brag gis gnyis te /
translated: By these, the Bhagavān is twofold by way of the distinction of abandonment and attainment.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: It shows the perfection of one's own aim.

original: mtshan gzhi brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi brtag par bya'o //
translated: The basis of characteristics should be examined.

original: de dag spangs pa ni rnam par mi rtog @273a * //🔽pa'i zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag spangs pa ni rnam par mi rtog @273a * // pa'i zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The abandonment of those is called the nondiscriminative.

original: mtshan gzhi yang mtshon par bya ba'i dngos pos brtag par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa yin pas brtag pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi yang mtshon par bya ba'i dngos pos brtag par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa yin pas brtag pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that the basis of characteristics is also a characteristic that should be examined by means of the thing to be characterized, and that is discrimination.

original: de dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of those is called the nondiscriminative.

original: de nyid rang nyid gang gis kyang rtag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rang nyid gang gis kyang rtag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That itself is not to be made permanent by anyone,

original: gzhan gyi rtog pa po yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtog pa po yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it is not the thinker of another. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni rtog pa dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pa dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: By this, freedom from conceptual thought is shown.

original: chos kyi sku la ltos nas kyang mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po yin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyis kyang gzugs kyi sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang sku spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la ltos nas kyang mtshon par bya ba'i dngos po yin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyis kyang gzugs kyi sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang sku spangs pa'o //
translated: In dependence on the Dharma Body, the thing to be characterized and the characteristic are also abandoned, as well as the Form Body and the marks of a great being.

original: dang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don gyi rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don gyi rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba ste /
translated: The word and has the meaning of definite inclusion, and it is to be applied in the same order.

original: de nyid snang ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: That is qualified by “without appearance,” and so on.

original: de nyid dpal rnyog pa med pa'i bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de nyid dpal rnyog pa med pa'i bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: That is the meaning of “the glorious Bhagavān, stainless.”

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnal 'byor ma'i de kho na nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid can /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnal 'byor ma'i de kho na nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid can /
translated: The nature of the perfect Buddha is the reality of the Yoginī, the nature of all the Tathāgatas,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning of “Vajrasattva.”

original: de skad du yang rgyal ba'i sras po de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i gzugs las ma mtshon pa'i chos las ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad du yang rgyal ba'i sras po de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i gzugs las ma mtshon pa'i chos las ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the Victor’s son [Nāgārjuna] says, “That is not remembered by the form of the Buddha, but by the Dharma that is not an image.

original: gang na sems med pa yid kyi rgyu ba med pa der /
analyzed: gang na sems med pa yid kyi rgyu ba med pa der /
translated: Where there is no mind, no mental activity,🔽in that way, the Buddha is to be remembered as inseparable.”

original: de ltar sangs rgyas dbyer med rjes su dran par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gang gis nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas dbyer med rjes su dran par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gang gis nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: And, “Whoever sees me as form,

original: gang gis nga la sgrar thos pa //
analyzed: gang gis nga la sgrar thos pa //
translated: and whoever hears me as sound,

original: log par song la zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: log par song la zhugs pa ste //
translated: has entered a wrong path,

original: skye bo de yis nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo de yis nga mi mthong //
translated: That person does not see me.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The leaders are the Dharma body.

original: chos nyid du ni sangs rgyas lta //🔽chos nyid shes par bya bar ni //
analyzed: chos nyid du ni sangs rgyas lta // chos nyid shes par bya bar ni //
translated: See the Buddha as reality.

original: rgyal bas kyang ni mi bskyod do //
analyzed: rgyal bas kyang ni mi bskyod do //
translated: The Victorious One cannot be moved

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: from the knowledge of reality.

original: gzugs ni 'dir mtshan dang dpe byad do //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'dir mtshan dang dpe byad do //
translated: Form here is the major and minor marks.

original: chos nyid ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos nyid ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: Reality is the Dharma to be taught.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bdun no //
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bdun no //
translated: Mind is the seven collections of consciousness.

original: yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs so //
translated: Intellect is the defiled collection of consciousness.

original: gzugs ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis te /
analyzed: gzugs ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis te /
translated: Form is the major and minor marks.

original: gnyis kas kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid la 'jug par byed pas spong ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid la 'jug par byed pas spong ba ste /
translated: Both of them are abandoned because they engage the Blessed One.

original: de kho na nyid ma yin par mthong bas thams cad 'dis spong bar byed pas chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin par mthong bas thams cad 'dis spong bar byed pas chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
translated: Reality of phenomena is all of them because they are abandoned by seeing what is not reality.

original: chos nyid ni chos kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: Reality is the reality of phenomena.

original: chos kyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Dharma body is the Dharma body.

original: shes par bya ba'i nye bar @273b mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i nye bar @273b mtshon par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the illustration.

original: gang rgyal bas kyang mi dpyod pa ni gang zhig blo'i yul ma yin pas gang yin pa mtshon par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rgyal bas kyang mi dpyod pa ni gang zhig blo'i yul ma yin pas gang yin pa mtshon par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not analyzed even by the Victorious Ones is not an object of the intellect, and so it is not something that can be indicated.

original: de dag gis chos kyi sku bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gis chos kyi sku bshad do //
translated: These explain the dharmakāya.

original: phan pa'i sgras longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis te /
analyzed: phan pa'i sgras longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis te /
translated: The word “beneficial” refers to the two, the enjoyment body and the emanation body,

original: de dag gis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir sku gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir sku gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: because they benefit migrating beings. Thus the three bodies are taught.

original: sku gsum gyi tshig gis kyang 'di dag dbyer med par 'jug pa'i ye shes lnga bshad de 'di ni 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi tshig gis kyang 'di dag dbyer med par 'jug pa'i ye shes lnga bshad de 'di ni 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: The three bodies also explain the five gnoses that are inseparable from them. This is the teaching on the result.

original: rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam yang bstan te /
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam yang bstan te /
translated: The very phrase “without turbidity” and so forth also teaches the path that has the characteristic of being inconceivable.

original: rnyog pa med pa ni ma bslad pa yin pas ma bslad pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ni ma bslad pa yin pas ma bslad pa'i don to //
translated: “Without turbidity” means “unadulterated,” and so it means “unadulterated.”

original: gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to “clear.”

original: phan pa ni 'dir sku gsum nyid gang du yang bsam du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan pa ni 'dir sku gsum nyid gang du yang bsam du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The beneficial is not something that can be conceived in any way as the three bodies themselves.

original: gzung bya snang ba med pas 'dir 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: gzung bya snang ba med pas 'dir 'dzin pa med de /
translated: Since the object of apprehension does not appear, the subject does not exist here.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “inconceivable.”

original: dpe med pa 'di ni rdo rje 'chang thob par byed pa'i lam gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: dpe med pa 'di ni rdo rje 'chang thob par byed pa'i lam gnyis med pa'o //
translated: This example is the nondual path that causes the attainment of Vajradhara.

original: brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa ste /
translated: It is inexpressible.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inconceivable.

original: nang du yang bsam pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: nang du yang bsam pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: It is not an object of thought even internally. This is the meaning.

original: rgod dang bcas pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod dang bcas pas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because it is free from agitation.

original: zhum pa dang rmugs pa dang gnyid med pas bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rmugs pa dang gnyid med pas bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is selflessness because it is free from depression, sluggishness, and sleep.

original: 'gyod pa dang the tshom bral bas dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang the tshom bral bas dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is free from regret and doubt.

original: mtshan gzhi bsam par bya ba dang / mtshan nyid sems par byed pa spangs pa ni bsam du med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi bsam par bya ba dang / mtshan nyid sems par byed pa spangs pa ni bsam du med pa ste /
translated: The absence of the basis of characteristics and the characteristic that is the thinker is the inconceivable.

original: sems med pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems med pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “without mind.”

original: sngar gyi snang ba med pa dang yul gyi bdag nyid dag las mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid spangs pa'i don 'di ni log pa yin te ;
analyzed: sngar gyi snang ba med pa dang yul gyi bdag nyid dag las mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid spangs pa'i don 'di ni log pa yin te ;
translated: The absence of the former appearance and the pure nature of the object are the meaning of “reversed.”

original: gang gi lam de gzhan gyis bsam gyi med pa dang / gzhan du sems pa ma yin pas snang ba med pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi lam de gzhan gyis bsam gyi med pa dang / gzhan du sems pa ma yin pas snang ba med pa'i don to //
translated: Since that path is not thought by others and is not thought as other, it is the meaning of non-appearance.

original: de yang cung zad kyang yul yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang cung zad kyang yul yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not an existent object at all.

original: yul med pas bdag yul gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: yul med pas bdag yul gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: Since there is no object, it is the meaning of the self not being the nature of an object.

original: gzhan sems pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi sgo nas tshig snga ma gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sems pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi sgo nas tshig snga ma gnyis yin no //
translated: Since it is not thought as other, it is the other of the first two phrases.

original: las 'dis yang rang nyid kyi kun du brtags pa'i dngos po med pas /
analyzed: las 'dis yang rang nyid kyi kun du brtags pa'i dngos po med pas /
translated: By this action, since one's own imagined entity does not exist,

original: rang nyid med pa'i don te /
analyzed: rang nyid med pa'i don te /
translated: it is the meaning of one's own nonexistence.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the absence of characteristics.

original: rang nyid rgyud la gnas pa'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i don te /🔽rang gis brtag par bya ba ma yin pas mtshan nyid med @274a * //
analyzed: rang nyid rgyud la gnas pa'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i don te / rang gis brtag par bya ba ma yin pas mtshan nyid med @274a * //
translated: It is the meaning of the absence of one's own continuum of imagination.🔽Since it is not to be imagined by oneself, it is the meaning of the absence of characteristics.

original: pa'i don gyis rang nyid kyang brtag par bya ba ni rang bzhin med par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa'i don gyis rang nyid kyang brtag par bya ba ni rang bzhin med par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is not to be imagined by oneself, it is a synonym for the absence of nature.

original: rgyun gyi snga ma dang phyi ma'i tshul gyis rgyun du gnas pa la bsam bya dang sems pa gnyis la rag las pa med pas na rang la sems pa dang bsam bya'i rang bzhin med de /🔽rang gi sgo de ngag gi mtshan gzhi med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i tshig dag go //
analyzed: rgyun gyi snga ma dang phyi ma'i tshul gyis rgyun du gnas pa la bsam bya dang sems pa gnyis la rag las pa med pas na rang la sems pa dang bsam bya'i rang bzhin med de / rang gi sgo de ngag gi mtshan gzhi med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i tshig dag go //
translated: Therefore, it has no nature of thought and object of thought.

original: rang gi sgo'i don gyis kyang gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sgo'i don gyis kyang gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the term “own” should be understood in two ways:

original: rgyun la ltos pa dang / skad cig ma la ltos pas ni /
analyzed: rgyun la ltos pa dang / skad cig ma la ltos pas ni /
translated: in dependence on the continuum and in dependence on the moment.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sgo nas byas pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sgo nas byas pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is made in terms of self and other.

original: tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lam gyi lus bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lam gyi lus bstan pa ste /
translated: These two verses teach the body of the inconceivable path.

original: 'dis ni lam bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam bshad pa'o //
translated: This explains the path.

original: sangs rgyas te sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas te sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: “Buddha” is a superimposition.

original: de nyid de ni bsam par bya ba min zhing bsam du med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid de ni bsam par bya ba min zhing bsam du med pa'o //
translated: That itself is not to be thought of and is inconceivable.

original: 'on ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'on ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: What is to be done?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen pos de dang de ltar 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i phan pa la dmigs nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen pos de dang de ltar 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i phan pa la dmigs nas /
translated: In the phrase “the buddhas, etc.,” the buddhas, the Blessed Ones, by the power of their former vows, with their great compassion, which is devoid of any reference to a subject or object, are always intent on the welfare of the various beings.

original: sprul pa rnams 'bad pa med par rang gis rab tu 'jug par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: sprul pa rnams 'bad pa med par rang gis rab tu 'jug par bya ba nyid do //
translated: And so, without any effort on their part, their emanations are set into operation.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Continuously” means that this activity is uninterrupted.

original: de kho na nyid la gnas nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la gnas nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the nonconceptual concentration of the bodhisattvas who abide in reality,

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i sbyor bas gnas par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i sbyor bas gnas par bya ba'i don to //
translated: the bodhisattvas are to abide in the spontaneous practice of the perfections.

original: kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par mi 'dod pa 'gegs pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par mi 'dod pa 'gegs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “some say” and so on rejects the unacceptable position.

original: stong pa nyid shin tu stong pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu de dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid shin tu stong pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu de dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa spangs pas so //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is like a sky flower, and it is devoid of fearlessness, etc.

original: grag ces bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: “It is said” means that it is unacceptable.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni stong pa la sogs pa bar ma chod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni stong pa la sogs pa bar ma chod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Just like that” means the nature of the emptiness, etc., without interruption.

original: rgyu'i zhes bya ba ni blos gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i zhes bya ba ni blos gzhag pa'o //
translated: “Cause” is the placement by the mind.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje 'chang thams cad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dbyings kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje 'chang thams cad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dbyings kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: “Result” and so forth are the co-emergent Vajradhara, the nature of the inconceivable realm of reality in all ways.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin mthong ba'o //
translated: The nature of the essential body and reality is seen.

original: byang chub ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: “Enlightenment” is the result.

original: mngon du bya ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The realization of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-production.

original: bsgom pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni lam mo //
translated: “Meditation” is the path.

original: 'bras bu ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bya ba'o //
translated: “Result” is the action.

original: rgyu ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa'o //
translated: “Cause” is the agent.

original: de dag ma grub pas lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / @274b rdzogs pa ma yin pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / tshad mas bkag pas de dag nyid rang bzhin med pa 'di des brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ma grub pas lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / @274b rdzogs pa ma yin pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / tshad mas bkag pas de dag nyid rang bzhin med pa 'di des brjod pa'o //
translated: Since those are not established, they are not co-emergent, not complete, not things, and are refuted by valid cognition. This is said to be their lack of intrinsic nature.

original: 'bras bu la ltos nas rgyu yin la rgyu la ltos nas 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos nas rgyu yin la rgyu la ltos nas 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is a cause in dependence on the effect, and it is an effect in dependence on the cause.

original: ltos nas grub pa gang yin //
analyzed: ltos nas grub pa gang yin //
translated: What is established in dependence

original: ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: ma grub pa ste /
translated: is not established.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bcom ldan 'das thog ma ste skye ba yin la ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thog ma ste skye ba yin la ;
translated: The Blessed One said, “The beginning is birth,

original: tha ma ni 'gag pa'o //🔽gang la de dag med pas de nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de la de skad brjod de /
analyzed: tha ma ni 'gag pa'o // gang la de dag med pas de nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de la de skad brjod de /
translated: and the end is cessation.”

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not have those is said to be the nature of that, because it is free from causes and conditions.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po 'di dngos grub kyi sprul pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po 'di dngos grub kyi sprul pa ston pa yin te /
translated: By “seeing” and so forth, he shows the emanation of the great seal.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gsal ba'i mtha' las byung bas /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gsal ba'i mtha' las byung bas /
translated: From the end of the clarity of the illusion-like meditative concentration,

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du bya ba'i rang bzhin chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mkhyen pa nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du bya ba'i rang bzhin chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mkhyen pa nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: the nature of the direct realization of perfect awakening that is like an illusion of all phenomena is the knowledge that all phenomena are like illusions, which is the illusion-like pristine awareness.

original: ye shes de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ye shes de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes 'byung ste /
translated: By the power of cultivating that intuition, the intuition that is like a magical creation of various forms arises.

original: ye shes de dang ldan na de dang der sprul par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan na de dang der sprul par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when one possesses that intuition, one creates emanations here and there.

original: brtag pa ste nye bar brtags pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ste nye bar brtags pa'i cha'o //
translated: The portion of the analysis is the analysis.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is the Tathagata.

original: rdo rje can ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-holder is the Vajra-holder.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas so //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the Bodhisattvas and so forth.

original: de dag gis brtags pa ste sprul pa 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa ste sprul pa 'gyed pa'o //
translated: They emanate the analysis, i.e., the emanations.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor rnam par gzhag ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor rnam par gzhag ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the mandala should be described.

original: de la legs par gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gzhag pa re zhig ston to //
analyzed: de la legs par gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgom par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gzhag pa re zhig ston to //
translated: There, the mandala that is to be cultivated is taught by “well-established” and so forth.

original: legs par gnas pa ni gnas pa ste mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: legs par gnas pa ni gnas pa ste mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Well-established is abiding, i.e., not moving.

original: the tshom la sogs pa'i skyon spangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: the tshom la sogs pa'i skyon spangs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the faults of doubt and so forth are abandoned.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa thog ma nas zhi ba dang / nam mkha'i mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa thog ma nas zhi ba dang / nam mkha'i mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of suchness is the primordial non-arising, the primordial peace, the sameness as space, and so forth, because all the dharmas of that are included.

original: rnam pa de'i spyod yul yin pas na yul te /
analyzed: rnam pa de'i spyod yul yin pas na yul te /
translated: The object is the domain of that aspect.

original: dmigs pa'i chos thams cad gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos thams cad gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du'o //
translated: All the phenomena that are the objects are just that.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The so-called phenomena are the objects.

original: ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba stong pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba stong pa'o //
translated: The essence is the natural luminosity, the emptiness.

original: gdod nas dag ces bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gdod nas dag ces bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The primordial purity is the teaching.

original: rnyog pa med ces bya ba ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa med ces bya ba ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The stainless is the explanation.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of natural purity.

original: 'di ni rnam par brjod pa'o //🔽rang dang @275a * //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par brjod pa'o // rang dang @275a * //
translated: This is the expression.

original: gzhan la phan par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The yogi who desires benefit for self and other.

original: de nyid kyis na sems kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sems kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor gsungs so //
translated: By that alone, the mind mandala and the colored-powder mandala are taught.

original: phung po la sogs pa ni rdul tshon gyi'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ni rdul tshon gyi'o //
translated: The aggregates and so forth are the colored-powder mandala.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye mched do //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye mched do //
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the sense-fields.

original: khyad par ni rtogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni rtogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The “distinction” is the distinction of realization.

original: phung po la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa mtshon par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the aggregates, etc.,

original: lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “body,” etc.

original: phung po la sogs rnams la lus la sogs pa tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po la sogs rnams la lus la sogs pa tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the aggregates, etc. are not different from the body, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa la gsum ma gtogs par khams dang skye mched rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la gsum ma gtogs par khams dang skye mched rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Because the elements and sense-fields do not exist apart from the body, etc.

original: rdo rje gsum po nyid ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi don to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum po nyid ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the aggregates, sense-fields, and elements is the three vajras.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor de nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor de nyid do //
translated: “ That” refers to that very mandala.

original: brjod pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du bstan to //
analyzed: brjod pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du bstan to //
translated: “ Is described” means is taught in the aforementioned assembly mandala.

original: de nyid kyis ni phung po la sogs pa bshad pas gnyis su med pa bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni phung po la sogs pa bshad pas gnyis su med pa bstan te /
translated: By that very explanation of the aggregates, etc., non-duality is taught.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni gcig gis ni skye mched du gzung zhing gnyis pas ni khams te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni gcig gis ni skye mched du gzung zhing gnyis pas ni khams te /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the sense-fields by the first [word] and the elements by the second [word].

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yang lam gyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor du brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yang lam gyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor du brjod do //
translated: The contaminated mandala is also said to be the nature of the path.🔽The uncontaminated mandala is the aggregates, because it is the result.

original: 'bras bur gyur pas yang zag pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di dag nyid zag pa med pa'i phung po rnams lta ba de la tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ni phung po'o //🔽thod rgal la sogs pa ni skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pas yang zag pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di dag nyid zag pa med pa'i phung po rnams lta ba de la tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ni phung po'o // thod rgal la sogs pa ni skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation.🔽The doors of liberation, such as emptiness, are the sense bases.

original: skye mched de byams pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched de byams pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: The sense bases are the elements, such as love.

original: 'di dag ni rang bzhin bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang bzhin bstan pa'o ;
translated: This is the teaching on the nature.

original: / me long lta bu la sogs pas ni gang gi phyir de ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: / me long lta bu la sogs pas ni gang gi phyir de ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par gyur pa ste /
translated: The mirror-like wisdom and so forth are the four corners.

original: 'di ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the four corners.

original: ye shes bzhi ni rtsibs bzhir bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi ni rtsibs bzhir bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The four wisdoms are subsumed in the four spokes.

original: rtsibs kyi sgra 'dis phyogs brdar btags pa'o //
analyzed: rtsibs kyi sgra 'dis phyogs brdar btags pa'o //
translated: The word “spoke” is a metaphor for direction.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni dang por shar gyi rtsibs so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni dang por shar gyi rtsibs so //
translated: The mirror-like pristine awareness is on the eastern spoke.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni lho'i rtsibs so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni lho'i rtsibs so //
translated: The pristine awareness of discernment is on the southern spoke.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni byang gi rtsibs so //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni byang gi rtsibs so //
translated: The pristine awareness of successful action is on the northern spoke.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni nub kyi rtsibs te logs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni nub kyi rtsibs te logs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pristine awareness of equality is on the western spoke.

original: de dag ni gru bzhi par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni gru bzhi par brtags pa ste /
translated: These are the four corners.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'o //🔽@275b sangs rgyas thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'o // @275b sangs rgyas thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pas so //
translated: This is the arrangement.🔽All buddhas are vajra holders.

original: ye shes nyid go'u ste /
analyzed: ye shes nyid go'u ste /
translated: The pristine awareness itself is Gauri,

original: mig gis de dang de'i rang gi yul du mthong bas so //
analyzed: mig gis de dang de'i rang gi yul du mthong bas so //
translated: because the eye sees that and its own object.

original: spyod yul yang bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: spyod yul yang bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The field is not taught,

original: ji srid du rang gi yul spyod pas gsungs so //
analyzed: ji srid du rang gi yul spyod pas gsungs so //
translated: because as long as one's own object is practiced, it is said.

original: lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang chos bzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste sgo'o //
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang chos bzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste sgo'o //
translated: The four mindfulnesses are the door, which are the body, feeling, mind, and phenomena.

original: brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gru bzhi ston pa ste /
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gru bzhi ston pa ste /
translated: The four corners are taught by expressed and so on.

original: chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs byams pa dang / de dag bzhi sbyin pa ni gru bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs byams pa dang / de dag bzhi sbyin pa ni gru bzhi ste /
translated: The four gifts of Dharma, material things, fearlessness, and love are the four corners.

original: mtshams kyi don to //
analyzed: mtshams kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the intermediate directions.

original: dbus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi snying por blta ste /
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi snying por blta ste /
translated: The center, etc. refers to the center of the mandala.

original: chos kyi dbyings shing tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes nyid dkyil 'khor gyi dbus so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shing tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes nyid dkyil 'khor gyi dbus so //
translated: The center of the mandala is the gnosis of the utterly pure dharmadhatu.

original: 'di lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad lam gyi dus su nges par grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad lam gyi dus su nges par grub pa ste /
translated: All the mandala deities are definitely accomplished at the time of the path.

original: nges par byas nas nyams su blangs nas /
analyzed: nges par byas nas nyams su blangs nas /
translated: Having definitely done that, one practices.

original: 'bras bu'i dus su nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus su nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of the result, they definitely occur.

original: zhi ba'i chos ni lam bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i chos ni lam bsdus pa ste /
translated: The peaceful dharmas are subsumed in the path.🔽The aggregates of ethics, samadhi, prajna, and so on are the center because they pacify the obscurations on the path.

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa'i phung po lam la sgrib pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ste /🔽stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa de dag nyid ni don te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa'i phung po lam la sgrib pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ste / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa de dag nyid ni don te /
translated: The activities of the buddhas are the meaning.

original: skyes bu'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don to //
translated: The powers, fearlessnesses, and so on are the meaning, the meaning for beings.

original: de dag snying po yin pas na dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de dag snying po yin pas na dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Since they are the essence, they are the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis kyang chos kyi dbyings nyid don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor du bstan to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis kyang chos kyi dbyings nyid don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor du bstan to //
translated: Also, by the very words mandala and so forth, the reality itself is taught as the ultimate mandala.

original: kun te dus gsum du yang grub pa ni lhan cig skyes pa drug pa ste yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun te dus gsum du yang grub pa ni lhan cig skyes pa drug pa ste yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment in accomplishment of all is the sixth, the innate, the transformation.

original: zhi ba ni gdod nas zhi ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba ni gdod nas zhi ba ste /
translated: The peace is the primordial peace,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dri ma med pa la ltos pa dang / nyes pa thams cad nye bar zhi pa'o ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dri ma med pa la ltos pa dang / nyes pa thams cad nye bar zhi pa'o ;
translated: which is the natural purity, and the pacification of all faults.

original: / chos te chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: / chos te chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma is the reality.

original: de nyid don gyi dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid don gyi dgos pa ste /
translated: That itself is the ultimate purpose.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa ste /🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag nyid dra ba la sogs pa'i bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa ste / ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag nyid dra ba la sogs pa'i bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The net and so forth are the teaching of the essence body.🔽 The net and so forth are the condensed meaning of the branches of meditative stabilization.

original: rta babs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag rgyas par bshad de ;
analyzed: rta babs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag rgyas par bshad de ;
translated: The gateways and so forth are the extensive explanation of the branches of meditative stabilization.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gsal ba'i mtha' phyin pa nyid ni rta babs so //
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gsal ba'i mtha' phyin pa nyid ni rta babs so //
translated: The ultimate clarity of the mind's samadhi is the archways.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa nyid ni do shal te /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa nyid ni do shal te /
translated: The mind's samadhi entering without fabrication is the garlands.

original: 'bab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of flowing.

original: gal te mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa la /🔽gal te na mngon par @276a * //
analyzed: gal te mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa la / gal te na mngon par @276a * //
translated: If it enters with fabrication,🔽then it is without fabrication.

original: 'du byed pa med pa ni dra ba phyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed pa med pa ni dra ba phyed pa'o //
translated: The half-net is

original: brag ca lta bu thams cad kyi chos rtogs pa nyid dril bu'o //
analyzed: brag ca lta bu thams cad kyi chos rtogs pa nyid dril bu'o //
translated: the realization of all phenomena as like an echo.

original: lhag par mos pa'i chos thams cad skyed pa ston pa nyid rdo rje'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i chos thams cad skyed pa ston pa nyid rdo rje'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The vajra garland is the teaching of the generation of all phenomena of interest.

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of phenomena:

original: ston pa'i lung dang lhag par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshul gyis so ;
analyzed: ston pa'i lung dang lhag par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshul gyis so ;
translated: those of the teacher's transmission and those of the nature of realization.

original: / dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa las grol bas /
analyzed: / dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa las grol bas /
translated: Since one is liberated from the grasping of nonentity and so on,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' klas pa mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing khebs pa sems nyid bla re'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' klas pa mnyam pa nyid du 'jug cing khebs pa sems nyid bla re'o //
translated: the mind's canopy enters and covers the limits of the element of space.

original: da ni skad cig ma dang dga' ba bzhi bshad par bya'o /
analyzed: da ni skad cig ma dang dga' ba bzhi bshad par bya'o /
translated: Now, the four moments and joys are to be explained.

original: de la phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge ba bstan te /
translated: There, the good is taught by the garland, etc.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig la nye bar mtshon par dga' ba'i rang bzhin bde ba'i rnam pa'i snang ba nyid thams cad du phreng ba dang gos dang rnga yab la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig la nye bar mtshon par dga' ba'i rang bzhin bde ba'i rnam pa'i snang ba nyid thams cad du phreng ba dang gos dang rnga yab la sogs pa'o //
translated: The garland, cloth, fan, etc. are the appearance of the aspect of bliss, the nature of joy, which is illustrated by the various moments.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i ye shes te /
translated: The supreme joy intuition is by the vajra, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la mtshon pa'o //
translated: It is illustrated by the moment of maturation.🔽The joys are in the corners, by the mind of the aspect of bliss at the time of the vajra-lotus awareness, etc.

original: rdo rje padma rig pa la sogs pa'i dus su dga' ba bde ba'i rnam pa'i sems nyid kyis dga' ba rnams grvar son rdo rje'i don de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /🔽de dag gis brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i don gyis bems po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje padma rig pa la sogs pa'i dus su dga' ba bde ba'i rnam pa'i sems nyid kyis dga' ba rnams grvar son rdo rje'i don de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa ste / de dag gis brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i don gyis bems po ste /
translated: The innate is by the vajra meaning of that, etc.🔽It is called the inanimate, by the meaning of that which is not to be imagined.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the characteristic-free.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i phyag rgya rnams ni bsgom par bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i phyag rgya rnams ni bsgom par bya ba ste /
translated: The mudras of the coemergent dakinis are to be meditated upon.

original: rang gi cha'i rang bzhin ni bsgom pa ste bde mchog byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi cha'i rang bzhin ni bsgom pa ste bde mchog byung ba'o //
translated: The nature of one’s own part is the meditation, the arising of supreme bliss.

original: bsgom pa las skyes pa'i bde mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom pa las skyes pa'i bde mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “arising from meditation” is supreme bliss.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni bcom ldan 'das ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni bcom ldan 'das ma'o //
translated: The dakini is the Bhagavati.

original: sdom pa ni bcom ldan 'das te rdo rje sems dpa' 'am gzhan dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: sdom pa ni bcom ldan 'das te rdo rje sems dpa' 'am gzhan dag kyang ngo //
translated: The pledge is the Bhagavat, Vajrasattva, or others.🔽Their arising is the arising of the coemergent itself, the instant free from characteristics, through the arising of the dakini and supreme bliss.

original: de dag shar bas ni bzhengs pa ste mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig la lhan cig skyes pa nyid mkha' 'gro ma dang bde mchog shar bas dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag shar bas ni bzhengs pa ste mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig la lhan cig skyes pa nyid mkha' 'gro ma dang bde mchog shar bas dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “arising” is as stated.

original: grva dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dga' bral te /
analyzed: grva dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dga' bral te /
translated: The “corners” and so on refer to the separation of joy.

original: rdo rje ste rin po che ni nor bu ste bde ba la spyod pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje ste rin po che ni nor bu ste bde ba la spyod pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir /
translated: The vajra, the jewel, the gem, and the bliss are specified because they are the nature of the experience of bliss.

original: rnam pa med pa'i skad cig ma la dga' ba'i dga' ba rtogs pa nyid /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i skad cig ma la dga' ba'i dga' ba rtogs pa nyid /
translated: The realization of the joy of joy in the instant free from aspects is

original: gra ba'i mtshams thams cad du rdo rje rin chen gyis spras pa ste zur thams cad du nye bar mtshon pa nyid du padmo rnams 'dus te /
analyzed: gra ba'i mtshams thams cad du rdo rje rin chen gyis spras pa ste zur thams cad du nye bar mtshon pa nyid du padmo rnams 'dus te /
translated: All the corners of the platform are adorned with vajra jewels, and in all the corners are assembled lotuses, which are indicated by the [vajra] jewels.

original: nang du chud pa'o //🔽@276b rdo rje rin chen spras pas mdzes pa nyid ni dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: nang du chud pa'o // @276b rdo rje rin chen spras pas mdzes pa nyid ni dkyil 'khor te /
translated: [The platform] is enclosed [by the lotuses].🔽The mandala is beautiful with the adornment of vajra jewels.

original: rdo rje rin po che'i tog go //
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che'i tog go //
translated: [It is] the top ornament of the vajra jewel.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don ni don dam pa de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don ni don dam pa de kho na nyid do //
translated: The meaning of if and so forth: the meaning is the ultimate reality.

original: shes rab kyi de nyid mthong ba ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi de nyid mthong ba ni zla ba'o //
translated: The vision of the reality of wisdom is the moon.

original: thabs kyi de nyid mthong ba ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi de nyid mthong ba ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The vision of the reality of method is the sun.

original: shes rab la sogs pa nye bar sdud pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa nye bar sdud pa ste /
translated: [It is] the gathering of wisdom and so forth.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is the nature of that.

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa ye shes ni thams cad rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa ye shes ni thams cad rtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the wisdom just explained is the realization of everything.

original: mnyam sbyar te 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam sbyar te 'dus pa'o //
translated: [It is] the union, the assembly.

original: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: [It is] without characteristics.

original: de dang de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pas dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pas dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'o //
translated: Since it abandons the characteristics of such and such aspects, [it is] entered into the mandala.

original: de nyid bshad ma thag pa'i rtog pa thams cad de brjod pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad ma thag pa'i rtog pa thams cad de brjod pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa'o //
translated: That is the stage of the vajra-holder of all buddhas, the expression of all the just-mentioned concepts.

original: des na dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
analyzed: des na dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the maṇḍala,

original: sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the fire sacrifice, etc.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ste tha mal pa'i rtog pa ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ste tha mal pa'i rtog pa ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: [It is] non-conceptual, having completely abandoned ordinary concepts.

original: mtshon pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: The indication is the memory.

original: dpyod pa ste rang rang gi rang bzhin las so sor rtog par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ste rang rang gi rang bzhin las so sor rtog par gyur pa ste /
translated: The analysis is the individual investigation of their own natures.

original: dngos po thams cad bdag nyid gang yin pa des dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bdag nyid gang yin pa des dpyod pa'o //
translated: It is the analysis of the nature of all things.

original: dngos po kun gyi 'joms par byed pa stong pa nyid kyi shes rab ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi 'joms par byed pa stong pa nyid kyi shes rab ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “the wisdom of emptiness that destroys all things” is that

original: rnam par 'byed pas dpyod pa ste rnam par phye ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pas dpyod pa ste rnam par phye ba nyid do //
translated: the analysis is the differentiation, the very differentiation.

original: rang rang gi rnam par shin tu stong pa nyid me ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi rnam par shin tu stong pa nyid me ste /
translated: The fire is the emptiness of each and every one of them.

original: dngos por 'dzin pa thams cad bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por 'dzin pa thams cad bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it burns all apprehensions of entities.

original: bsreg par bya ba ni rang bzhin med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba ni rang bzhin med par byed pa ste /
translated: The thing to be burned is the one that makes [things] natureless.

original: de ltar rab tu gnas par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu gnas par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is the meaning of consecration.

original: sems las byung ba ni sems kyis gzhag pa'o //🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po ni sems kyis sbyar ba ste ;🔽sems las byung ba yang gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni sems kyis gzhag pa'o // gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po ni sems kyis sbyar ba ste ; sems las byung ba yang gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mental factor is the placement by the mind.🔽The entity of form, etc. is the application by the mind.🔽The mental factor is also the form-source, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras khams kyang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras khams kyang ngo //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the elements.

original: rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “consecration,” etc.,

original: dang po'i don gyi rkyen can no //
analyzed: dang po'i don gyi rkyen can no //
translated: it is the condition of the primary meaning.

original: brtan par gyur par sems mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: brtan par gyur par sems mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: The mind becomes stable and does not move.

original: sems ni yod do //
analyzed: sems ni yod do //
translated: The mind exists.

original: lus ngag yid kyi rnam pa de nyid ngo bo sems so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyi rnam pa de nyid ngo bo sems so zhes gsungs te /
translated: That very nature of the body, speech, and mind is the mind.

original: ston pa thams cad kyis mgrin gcig tu'o //
analyzed: ston pa thams cad kyis mgrin gcig tu'o //
translated: All the teachers say this in one voice.

original: gcig tu gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The one nature is the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, as for “secret,” etc.,

original: gsang chen gang yin pa de ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid ces nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang chen gang yin pa de ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid ces nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: that which is the great secret is taught to be the characteristic of mantra.🔽It is unborn and appears

original: skye ba med cing snang ba @277a * //
analyzed: skye ba med cing snang ba @277a * //
translated: There is no arising, yet appearances manifest.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges par bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, etc. is the teaching.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa gsang ba chen po'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa gsang ba chen po'i don to //
translated: The non-arising of all phenomena is the meaning of the great secret.

original: lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin phung po nyid dang skye ba 'dzin pa nyid rigs so //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin phung po nyid dang skye ba 'dzin pa nyid rigs so //
translated: The gods, etc. are the nature, the aggregates themselves, and the grasping of birth.
